Package com.esri.mo2.src.cat

Definition of a model for applications using a Catalog of Content objects.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
CatalogModelListener An interface for objects wishing to be notified about CatalogModelEvents.
ContentProvider Defines a plugin for CatalogModel.
ProviderContent identifies Content objects that are constructed by a ContentProvider primarily to provide directory structure within the CatalogModel.
 

Class Summary
BaseContentProvider class provides a base implementation of ContentProvider.
CatalogModel Defines a model for applications using a Catalog of Content objects.
CatalogModelAdapter This class implements a simple adapter for CatalogModelListeners.
CatalogModelEvent This event is sent to a CatalogModelListener whenever a Connection has been successfully added to or removed from the CatalogModel, or the refresh method of CatalogModel has been called.
ConnectionContentProvider provides basic support for ContentProviders that require "hard" connections to an external data source, such as connections to databases.
ContentAction Defines parameters to be passed to ContentProvider.performAction()
ContextMenuAction defines an Action class that a ContextMenuProvider should use to populate a JMenu.
ContextMenuProvider Defines a plugin interface for pluggable context (popup) menus within the Catalog, based on the available content-types defined by a ContentProvider.
FeatureClassMenuProvider a ContextMenuProvider for Content that represent FeatureClass objects
 

Package com.esri.mo2.src.cat Description

Definition of a model for applications using a Catalog of Content objects.

This model is independent of the user interface and can be used within console and server applications. The CatalogModel provides a way to arrange Connection objects within a tree structure of the application's choosing. Content within the model can be accessed via a String path.

The arrangement of the tree is controlled by implementations of ContentProvider. Instances of ContentProvider can be added to or removed from the model at any time. Each instance defines the type of Connection object that can be added to a particular location in the model's tree, and indirectly, the Content objects that can be obtained there.

An application will normally use the plug-in facilities to define instances of ContentProvider (see com.esri.mo2.sys.spi.Provider). Several instances are provided with the standard MapObjects--Java Edition product JARs. These are automatically detected whenever the standard MapObjects JARs are present in the application's CLASSPATH. They define ContentProviders for the file system, ArcSDE databases, and ArcIMS Internet services. An application can add more ContentProviders or remove existing ones using static methods provided within CatalogModel. Alternatively, certain MapObjects JARs can be removed from the CLASSPATH to prevent the relevant plug-in from being detected.

The model can be dynamically updated at run-time by adding or removing Connection instances using the relevant methods within CatalogModel. Typically, this would be performed when an application provides an end-user a way to connect with a database or Internet service of a type that is supported by one of the registered ContentProviders. Once the Connection is added to the model, applications can traverse into new Content provided by the Connection.

If a Connection is already known to the CatalogModel, then adding it again to the model will not cause anything to occur. Similarly, removing a Connection that is not present in the model has no effect. However, when a Connection is successfully added or removed, a ModelEvent will be sent to all interested ModelListeners, identifying the Content added or removed, as well as the parent Content.
